news.title: UK Tribunal Strikes Down Visa and Mastercard Fees
news.body: The UK's Competition Appeal Tribunal has ruled that Visa and Mastercard's multilateral interchange fees breach European competition law. This pivotal decision could reshape transaction fee structures, potentially reducing costs for retailers and intensifying competition in the European payments landscape. It highlights the rigorous regulatory environment facing major payment networks.

news.title: Belgian Authorities Investigate Worldline for Money Laundering
news.body: Belgium's prosecutors are probing the local unit of payment processor Worldline for alleged money laundering. This investigation underscores the heightened regulatory scrutiny on financial practices within Europe's major payment processing firms, which could impact Worldline's operational integrity and market reputation.

news.title: Starling Bank Plans U.S. Market Entry via Acquisition
news.body: Starling Bank, a UK-based digital bank, is eyeing an expansion into the U.S. market through the acquisition of a local bank. This strategic move reflects the bank's ambition to penetrate the lucrative U.S. banking sector and is indicative of the broader trend of digital banks leveraging acquisitions for international growth.

news.title: Lesaka Technologies Acquires Bank Zero for $62 Million
news.body: In a significant move within the fintech sector, South Africa's Lesaka Technologies is set to acquire Bank Zero Mutual Bank for approximately $62 million. This acquisition signals a robust expansion in South Africa's digital banking landscape and underscores the ongoing consolidation trend in the global fintech industry.

news.title: Anchorage Digital Ends Support for USDC Stablecoin
news.body: Cryptocurrency custodian Anchorage Digital has announced it will cease support for the USDC stablecoin, based on its new 'Stablecoin Safety Matrix.' This decision has stirred controversy with USDC issuer Circle and could significantly affect the stablecoin's market position and user trust.

curiosity.text: Did you know that the first credit card was issued in 1950 by Diners Club and was made of cardboard?
